learning_outcomes.description: Integrate and apply OHS knowledge within a work environment.
Acquire high level skills that will enhance the application of existing knowledge.
Plan strategies to address and solve complex OHS issues and associated change management.
Demonstrate the ability to effectively communicate orally and in writing with both workers, management, and other relevant stakeholders.
Develop a high level of competence in the application of OHS and related skills and practice.
Apply knowledge of ethics to OHS professional practice.
Appraise your own performance by reflective practice in order to achieve the best possible outcomes.

assessments.task_description:
Students are to develop a learning contract in consultation with their workplace supervisor that outlines a range of OHS tasks that the student will undertake during the placement. 

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly note any use of AI or MT. A failure to declare generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date and time. Refer to Blackboard for the submission link. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets are required. Submission via email is not accepted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: This assessment is graded on a pass/fail basis, and there is no system for applying "mark" penalties. If the assessment item is not submitted by the submission due date outlined in the course profile, it will be considered a non-submission, resulting in a "fail".
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students are required to undertake a range of OHS tasks that demonstrate their ability to apply OHS theoretical knowledge and technical/non-technical skills in practice. During the 240 hour placement students are to complete a range of OHS tasks and submit a written description of three (3) of these tasks and participate in three (3) one-on-one online discussions of three (3) of these tasks with the course coordinator. For each of the Written tasks, students are required to complete the OHS Task Form and upload supporting evidence to Turnitin.

assessments.task_description:
Students are required to choose four (4) values from the Australian Institute of Health and Safety and write a reflection on how they applied each of the four values into professional practice and any potential challenges faced in their application during the OHS Industry placement.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
